intro: Streptocarpus actinoflorus, commonly known as the star-flowered streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of blue and purple. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, featuring tubular leaves and a compact, bushy form. Its flowers are borne on erect stems and are often clustered in racemes, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Streptocarpus actinoflorus thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
